bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, February 4, 1941

div1.p: Hutchison regrets that no additional copies of the Alumni Bulletin are available. Mabel Lazear will receive the memorial plate honoring Jesse Lazear. He requests that Hench complete the biographical questionnaire for the Alumni Directory.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, February 4, 1941

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
February 4, 1941

div1.p:
Answering your letter of January twenty-ninth,
McClain advises me that he sent such copies as he had
of the “Mile Post” on about the day that you wrote
this letter. You have received them by now probably.
I hope they will help out a little bit, but I think you
ought to consider the possibility of reprinting this
address so that you can send it out in a more general
way. I would like to have your thoughts on that.

I am awfully sorry that we have no copies of
the Alumni Bulletin.

The plate to Mrs. Lazear went some days ago.
We did not put a card into it because we knew you
could write to her. I am enclosing herewith the bill.

I have just checked with Mr. Brewer about the
biographical questionnaire and he says that while we do
have considerable information, he thinks you ought to
fill it out. It will make the information more nearly
accurate. It is to be included, or a portion of it, in
a new Alumni Directory which is being published this
year. He furthermore reports that the vast information
which I have given him concerning you is unprintable.

I am interested in what you tell about Buddy's
visit. He faces a very hard decision. It is something
on which no one else can help him too much. I am glad,
however, that he had a chance to talk to you.
Give our love to Mary and the children.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
